data.title: Am I the only one missing "Racing" games such as MSR, PGR, Motorstorm, Wipeout and Ridge Racer?
data.meta_description: I know we still have some nice racing games out there and we still got Codemasters and the Forza series, but am I the only one missing games such as PGR...

I know we still have some nice racing games out there and we still got Codemasters and the Forza series, but am I the only one missing games such as PGR, Motorstorm, Wipeout and Ridge Racer? I always enjoyed them, heck even Driveclub had it's nice moments, but nearly all original studios are dead/disbanded by now.

Hotshot Racing is good and feels great to play, but it's pretty barebones - Team Sonic Racing was similarly good on a fundamental level, and even the team racing gimmick wasn't outwardly-terrible, but it still didn't really live up to its predecessor. You can really tell it's from the pedigree that made the stellar Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed, which still holds up extremely well. We need more racing games like that.

Sumo Digital makes amazing arcade racing games, but they absolutely need the time, budget and direction to produce nice and meaty ones.

Absolutely. The Motorstorm games were so good. Pacific Rift was one of my favorite games last gen. The original game was also so much fun. The things I'd do for a PS5 remaster trilogy...

Driveclub was great as well. The launch was botched, but after a couple of weeks it was a good experience, loved the driving physics.

Thankfully we still have the Forza Horizon series. 3 in particular was a blast, Australia was so well done. 4 is also really good, still playing it every now and then. And thankfully we also still have Codemasters, I usually love their games. Looking forward to Dirt 5.

Edit: Yeah Midnight Club was also super fun. I remember just driving around Los Angeles for hours. The city was super well done and the soundtrack was a bop. It's a shame they probably won't do another one because it doesn't print money like GTA does.

Edit2: Yeah also Split Second. We had some incredible racing games last gen. I also just remembered FUEL and Nail'd, also very fun experiences.

Ridge Racer 8 is probably my most dreamed about game. It's still pretty mindboggling to me that Ridge Racer 7 was 1080p & 60 FPS given the... extreme lack of that on the PS3 and shit, even the current generation of stuff. The PSP games are excellent. I know the market has changed a ton, but honestly even an "AA" level Ridge would be stupidly exciting.

Anyway, I have a massive thing for racers from the late 90s/early 2000s. I don't think we'll ever really get a ton of new games in that genre from any of the old studios, but I'd flip out for being able to play WaveRace 64 on my Switch, and getting more home ports of Sega racers the quality of Daytona HD. Give me Daytona 2 & Scud Race you cowards.
